item.title: Sarah add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "If we find ourselves with a desire that nothing in this world can satisfy, the most probable explanation is that we were made for another world." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Ted Dekker
item.description: "The four rules of writing... 1. Write to discover. 2. There is no greater discovery than love. 3. All love comes from the Creator. 4. Write what you will." -- Ted Dekker

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Harriet Beecher Stowe
item.description: "It's a matter of taking the side of the weak against the strong, something the best people have always done." -- Harriet Beecher Stowe

item.title: Sarah add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description:
"All that is gold does not glitter, Not all those who wander are lost; The old that is strong does not wither, Deep roots are not reached by the frost.
From the ashes a fire shall be woken, A light from the shadows shall spring; Renewed shall be blade that was broken, The crownless again shall be king." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Sarah add a quote by William Butler Yeats
item.description: "The creations of a great writer are little more than the moods and passions of his own heart, given surnames and Christian names, and sent to walk the earth." -- William Butler Yeats

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Pádraig Pearse
item.description: "Tír gan teanga, tír gan anam. A country without a language is a country without a soul." -- Pádraig Pearse

item.title: Sarah add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "You see things; you say, 'Why?' But I dream things that never were; and I say 'Why not?" -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Jonathan Swift
item.description: "Some men, under the notion of weeding out prejudice, eradicate virtue, honesty and religion." -- Jonathan Swift

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Ted Dekker
item.description: "Dive deep. Drown willingly" -- Ted Dekker

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Sarah add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "I can't imagine a man really enjoying a book and reading it only once." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Sarah add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "I know now, Lord, why you utter no answer. You are yourself the answer. Before your face questions die away. What other answer would suffice?" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Sarah add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "I never exactly made a book. It's rather like taking dictation. I was given things to say. " -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Sarah add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Courage is not simply one of the virtues but the form of every virtue at the testing point, which means at the point of highest reality. " -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Sarah add a quote by William Wilberforce
item.description: "You may choose to look the other way but you can never say again that you did not know." -- William Wilberforce

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "Books serve to show a man that those original thoughts of his aren't very new after all." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Joshua Lawrence Chamberlain
item.description: "I know in whom all my highest hopes and dearest joys are centered. I know in whom my whole heart can rest — so sweetly and so surely." -- Joshua Lawrence Chamberlain

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "Either write something worth reading or do something worth writing." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Joss Whedon
item.description: "I write to give myself strength. I write to be the characters that I am not. I write to explore all the things I'm afraid of. " -- Joss Whedon

item.title: Sarah add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Don't say it was delightful; make us say delightful when we've read the description. You see, all those words (horrifying, wonderful, hideous, exquisite) are only like saying to your readers Please will you do the job for me." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Sarah add a quote by John Adams
item.description: "Let us tenderly and kindly cherish therefore, the means of knowledge. Let us dare to read, think, speak, and write ." -- John Adams

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "I want to do something splendid… Something heroic or wonderful that won’t be forgotten after I’m dead… I think I shall write books." -- Louisa May Alcott

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Ted Dekker
item.description: "The world’s bumper sticker reads: Life sucks, and then you die. Perhaps Christian bumper stickers should read: Life sucks, but then you find hope and you can’t wait to die." -- Ted Dekker

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Ted Dekker
item.description: "Turn to the light. Don't fear the shadow it creates." -- Ted Dekker

item.title: Sarah add a quote by John Bunyan
item.description: "One leak will sink a ship, and one sin will destroy a sinner." -- John Bunyan

item.title: Sarah add a quote by John Bunyan
item.description: "In prayer it is better to have a heart without words than words without a heart. " -- John Bunyan

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Patrick Ness
item.description: "Stories are important...They can be more important than anything. If they carry the truth." -- Patrick Ness

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Patrick Ness
item.description: "Stories are the wildest things of all. Stories chase and bite and hunt." -- Patrick Ness

item.title: Sarah add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description:
"Love is not love Which alters when it alteration finds, Or bends with the remover to remove. O no, it is an ever-fixed mark That looks on tempests and is never shaken; It is the star to every wand'ring bark, Whose worth's unknown, although his height be taken."
<i>(Sonnet 116)</i>" -- William Shakespeare
